headline: Irish Fried Cabbage with Bacon
description: This fried cabbage with bacon recipe is easy to make in a deep skillet with reserved bacon drippings for a tasty side on St. Patrick's Day or any day!
name: Irish Fried Cabbage with Bacon
recipeIngredient: 1 small head cabbage, cored and finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Cook bacon in a deep skillet over medium heat until crisp, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove bacon from skillet and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Reserve 1/4 cup drippings in skillet.
Add cabbage to hot bacon drippings; cook and stir over medium heat until cabbage wilts, 5 to 7 minutes.
Crumble bacon over cabbage. Stir and simmer until bacon is warmed, 2 to 3 minutes. Season with black pepper.

review.reviewBody: This is just about the easiest and tastiest cabbage I've ever had! I definitely recommend it!

This is the way I have fixed fried cabbage for years...And...Yes! I now live in the south but my mother fixed it this way too and I was raised in the north!! Simple, easy and delicious. You can substitute butter for the bacon grease with great results too.
Followed exactly as written. It was a hit at our St Patrick potluck. If you love bacon, you need to try this.
Very tasty and easy to make.
Delicious! I poured off some bacon fat and added some butter.

I’m not a fan of cabbage but I’m willing to try anything with bacon. This side dish is good, even though it’s not good for you. I used a package of coleslaw to cut down on prep time and only 5 slices of regular bacon and was liberal with the pepper. Great side to our corned beef brisket.
Very good! Ate it with Wrap & Kirkland Dinner Hot Dog.
Omg I can’t believe how good this is!! Cabbage and bacon who would have thought 2 ingredients could be so tasty?? I did add a teas of brown sugar and some salt. Don’t hesitate, make this!!!!!
Pretty good! Best part was that it was so simple. Thank you.
Absolutely delicious. I followed the recipe but wish I had a larger and deeper pan. Oh well, this is a definite keeper!
I added spinach carrots and artichokes plus cream. It was yum

I love fried cabbage! I add some beef bouillon and reduce it, and add a little cider vinegar to serve.
Cabbage is a gift that proves God loves the Irish!
This dish is very low in carbs so will make again.
This was amazing! I added garlic and onion powder along with a med size onion and salted to taste. Keeper!!!
this was simple and delish. even my picky husband and son who hate veggies ate it all up for our st. paddy's dinner. thank you for the recipe

I've made cabbage dishes that have bacon grease in them before, so I knew that I prefer less than what this recipe called for. I probably used 2 T instead of 1/4 cup. It turned out great! I added a little Better than Bouillon to season as well as some salt. My company ate almost the entire bowl. Very good!
Simply the quickest most delicious dish!! I LOVE it! Sure you can add to it but I love it just like the recipe!
I've made this a few times and every time has been delicious. I made no changes to the recipe the first time. I added chopped onion the second time. Quick and easy with a great taste.
I made this for my husband and in-laws who don't like vegetables, but they loved this recipe! (Who doesn't like a whole package of bacon?)
Very simple, very good.
Did not make any changes, delicious, will make it often now
I have been making something very close to this for years and love it, add some cooked noodles and fry it up
My husband loved this dish. Will make again.
Love this!!

I tried to make this but didn't have cabbage and I only had ground beef, so I had to imagine it with bacon. I must have a good imagination because it was so good I can eat it all day. Next time I will get bacon!
I love these. I will be making these again.
Instead of pepper for seasoning, I put in powdered onion and garlic and Johnny's season salt. Everyone loved it and I would definitely make it again!
it doesnt get a 5 star due to the salt content ...I've been making this for years, but at the end, I add some cider vinegar, and serve with wide egg noodles and grated cheese. Dinner in one pot!
My husband and I really liked this recipe. I just have to remember to get good quality bacon to add in. Thank you
Super easy! Made it according to the recipe, but i did remove some of the bacon grease, and added the bacon back at the end so it was crunchy. No sugar either, very good.
I added boiled potatoes and fried them along with the cabbage. Sometimes I use leftover steamed cabbage and just fry until warm.
Excellent, everyone loved it, had to make more.

This is so good I would marry it if I could! It's fast, easy, and divinely delicious! My whole family wanted seconds, and still went back for more, when I had to tell them it was all gone. Will definitely make again.
Amazing and simple! I could eat this all day its so good. Great as a side dish or you can add chicken or other meat to make it a main dish.
Next time, I'll add 1/2 tsp salt and not bother measuring out the grease. It comes out to about 1/4 cup anyway, so just remove the bacon and throw in the cabbage!

Wow! This......was......amazing!!!!!! Our family has decided to call it cholesterol cabbage. Lol but man oh man did we all enjoy. The kids and the adults. Including my hubby who had sworn off cabbage after traumatic cabbage events in his childhood. Everybody asked me to make this again and we were all fighting for it. I've not made any of the similar yet more compiles recipes on this site, and I won't. This is fabulous without any extra effort.
This is real tasty version of cabbage.
My husband who cant stand cabbage really loved this. I'm guessing it is all the bacon that he really liked. It was really tasty and I will make this again.
Delicious and easy to prepare.
A very good use for cabbage. Added a bit of caraway seeds. Very good.

Saute chopped onions with the cabbage and when everything is soft, mix it,along with the bacon,into mashed potatoes. That dish is called Colcannon and served with melted butter in a well you make on top of the potatoes! I make that every St Pat's Day along with Corned Beef Wellington!

I have been eating this most of my life. My best friend's mother made this and I loved it so she would make it when I went to visit. I make it exactly like this recipe and try to never make too much because I can't stop eating it! I like it alone or as a side dish. It's great with some boiled or fried potatoes. Meat is not needed for this meal because there's BACON!
So good!
I like to add a sliced Apple to the cabbage - other than that- perfect!
fabulous recipe! Very pleased with the results. I added some chopped green pepper and sazon complete seasoning. I will be serving this often.
Yum!! I added a little onion, just cuz I had it to use up. We loved this.
I have some picky eaters and everyone loved it!
Very Delicious! Next time I am going to add a little vinegar, but all in all very good.
decent side for pork
This was good - will make again.
Definitely a side rather than a main dish, but it was good. We only used about half the bacon, too, and it was still great. Thanks!
After reading other reveiws I added 1/2 teaspoon brown sugar & some onions. Super excellent!!!! Also added this to mashed potatoes to make a pretty good colcannon.

This was good. I of course like everyone else made it my own. I made it as stated above and added extra cabbage, all beef smoked wieners and parmesan cheese and then when I dished it up I added hot sauce for my own taste. It was amazing!!!

I absolutely love fried cabbage and bacon, but for "Bubble and Squeak" you need very fine diced potatoes and l clove fine diced garlic, salt and pepper. Don't OVERCOOK the cabbage. It's fantastic with a little "bite" to it.

I made this for dinner tonight (wanting to get back to my southern roots). Oh my goodness, it didn't disappoint. I did add 1/2 teaspoon of brown sugar when cooking the cabbage, just as my grandmother did. I saved the leftovers and plan to eat them for lunch tomorrow. I am in the process of trying to figure out how to add a picture. For the first time in a long time, I took a picture.

Now that I've found this recipe again, I just wanted to give a review. I made this last night and it was yummy. I used 2 small heads of cabbage, so I doubled the bacon drippings amount. That was a bit much. Came out a lot greasier than I like but still edible. The only other minor changes I made were, I added 1 1/2 tsp of salt, 1/4 tsp pepper and only crumbled 10 strips of bacon into the cabbage. Next time I make this, and there will be a next time, I will stick to the 1/4 cup of drippings.

Raised in the South, we love our cabbage.. any way you fix it! I had to modify this recipe a bit with bacon drippings only since I didn't have any bacon on hand. My family loves everything spicy, so I seasoned it up with some garlic salt, salt and pepper, and a drop or two of liquid smoke flavoring. Then put a lid on and sauteed til wilted and crisp tender. YUM!!
We had almost a whole head of cabbage left in the fridge from another recipe and I didn't want to waste it. I'm so glad we tried this, it's delicious but definitely a treat with all the bacon!!
quick easy and delicious although i used blanched cabbage left over from making cabbage rolls....and added a small onion near the end of cooking the bacon
Super good and super easy!!
I added 2 tablespoon dijan mustard and 1 tablespoon sugar.

This was so Yummy!!!! Even my husband who doesn't like cabbage tried it and loved it!! I did add bout a half tble spoon of brown sugar, and lil bit of white sugar, salt and pepper. That added just a perfect amout of sweetness! I will def make this again! It was so nice to find a recipe just like what my mother used to make when I was a child! It sure brought back some memories of her cooking!! Thanks for sharing!!!!
One word... YUMMY!
We make this adding onions and noodles boiled in chicken broth, Very good!!!!
My grandmother used to make this for our Sunday dinners, so when I used this recipe, it sure brought back some pleasant memories! Thanks!
My mom was from the south, we also ate this all the time. She later added tomatoes and we ate this over rice. Brings back plenty of memories.

I've been making this for years..I shred the cabbage instead of chopping it cooks more evenly.
BIG TIP: you can also use pre-shredded cabbage from the grocery store, which makes it fast and easy.
I add whatever I have avail. onion red or yellow, celery chopped finely.
I also have prefried bacon in my freezer which is very convenient. And I keep the bacon grease in the refrigerator for seasoning other dishes. 
My husband loves this dish. And even if you don't like cabbage, you may want to try this, it just might change your mind on cabbage.

This is soooo good! I add about a tsp of brown sugar to help caramelize the cabbage but still retain it's crisp/tender qualities. Brussel sprouts are TDF prepared like this. I half them, steam them for a short time then throw them in the skillet. My future daughter in law says, "I now like brussel sprouts!"
I love this recipe but I put onion and green peppers in the bacon drippings until they soften and then add the cabbage.
I live in the South and this recipe is a staple in all households. There is nothing better if you like cabbage. Thanks for sharing.
